attributes.action: Reconsider the closing of soft play centres in Tier 3
attributes.additional_details:
The centres are a huge benefit to not only the children's development and social skills but also carers health and wellbeing.

These restrictions could dramatically effect the development of our children at such a crucial stage in their lives.

If children can attend nursery/school then surely soft play centres would also be considered as educational and safe.

As a new mother these centres have proved vital to me - we haven't been able to visit family and friends like we should have.
attributes.background:
We would like you to reconsider closing soft play centres in tier 3.
Soft play centres are following strict guidelines and users are following rules accordingly.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign instead:

Allow soft play areas and centres to reopen: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555523
